item.title: the pursuit of science for understanding our natural world
item.description: author: Cory Simon First, I recommend the book “A Crack in Creation: gene editing and the unthinkable power to control evolution” by the pioneer of the CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing technology, Jennifer Doudna, and her former graduate student, Samuel Sternberg. The book outlines the story of how the CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing technology was developed, discusses its potential to improve human and plant health, and deliberates over ethical questions surrounding its use.
